tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SensorData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    data_value FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE device_info (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(255),
    installation_date DATE,
    status VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Sensors (sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id INT,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  location VARCHAR(100),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  value FLOAT);

CREATE TABLE Devices (device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  device_name VARCHAR(50),
  location VARCHAR(100),
  status VARCHAR(20));

CREATE TABLE SensorData (data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  data_type VARCHAR(50),
  value FLOAT);

CREATE TABLE sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    data_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_readings (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    reading_value FLOAT,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    alert_message TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location TEXT,
    sensor_type TEXT,
    reading FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name TEXT,
    manufacturer TEXT,
    model TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE locations (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_name TEXT,
    latitude FLOAT,
    longitude FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    reading FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE device_sensor_mapping (
    device_id INT,
    sensor_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (device_id, sensor_id)
)
